page.title: 05Alf Kaufman School
page.content: Our school is for children with a physical disability and is named after a former mayor of Rochdale. Until recently, children in Rochdale with severe physical handicaps had to go to residential schools. In 1974 Fieldhouse School opened for these children and was known as a 'special' school. In 1978 the Warnock Report said that children with special needs ought to be able to integrate into ordinary schools and so our new school was built to join with Whittaker Moss Primary School. We join with the children next door for singing, P.E., swimming and other lessons. We also have special facilities such as a hydrotherapy pool and physiotherapy. Whittaker Moss children come from Norden but we are transported to school from all over the district.
